nodes.description: Can prusik and abseil, must understand the fundamentals of vertical safety (points of safety), give a bottom belay, and demonstrate clear vertical communication (on rope, abseiling, abseil when ready).

Clear understanding and demonstration of changeovers, deviations, and rebelays, when and why they are used e.g., understanding of IRT vs alpine ropework. Demonstrated ability to teach basic caving concepts and skills including prusiking, abseiling, and fireman's belays.
Understands and demonstrates entry level canyoning techniques e.g., rope/bag management, whistle communication, friction control, water hazards, sharp edges.
Must be able to rig a variety of styles and techniques including double strand, knot/biner blocks, releasables, and stone knots.
Demonstrates advanced canyoning skills, retrievables, ghosting, guided abseils, floating bags.
Can rig simple vertical caves on bolts or naturals including simple deviations and rebelays.
Can tie and explain uses and limitations of knots such as F8 OTB, F9 OTB, overhand, tape knot, barrel knot.
Advanced understanding of knots including F8 rethread, butterfly, clove hitch, munter, and bowlines.
Understands mechanical advantage, executes pickoffs, counterbalances, and improvised rescues.
Models safe leadership in vertical caving including planning, teaching, and navigation.
Advanced rescue knowledge including stretcher and high-efficiency hauls.

AKA Queen of The Underworld, Goblin King, Mud Monarch, Ruler of the Rope, Prime Grimister. This signoff doesn't mean you have nothing more to learn, but that you've developed the skills, knowledge, and experience to teach any caving skills that NUCC engages in.
Inducted and demonstrated capacity to perform various cave survey roles (book, laser, point, sketch).
Solid theoretical understanding of anchor placement, bolting hardware and techniques.
Although this signoff has only one prereq, you must model a set of leadership behaviours desirable by the club to safely and effectively lead people of all skill levels in horizontal caves.
